sys_metadata_link.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post">
    <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <category display_value="Note">83f60c3e1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcbaa</category>
        <github_id>23</github_id>
        <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/23</github_url>
        <message>GlideAggregate groups by the aggregated column by default (when using functions MAX, MIN or AVG).
So don't forget to use its setGroup method. 

Sample in comments section.
Credits: @János Szentpáli

var cmn_location_Ga = new GlideAggregate('cmn_location');
cmn_location_Ga.addNotNullQuery('u_node_id');
cmn_location_Ga.addAggregate('MAX', 'u_node_id');
cmn_location_Ga.setGroup(false);
cmn_location_Ga._query();
if (cmn_location_Ga._next()) {
	return +cmn_location_Ga.getAggregate('MAX', 'u_node_id');
} else {
	return 0;
}</message>
        <number>TIL0001016</number>
        <status>old</status>
        <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by>
        <sys_created_on>2020-05-16 15:54:19</sys_created_on>
        <sys_id>1974dfb91b3894108ed631d7dc4bcb71</sys_id>
        <sys_mod_count>5</sys_mod_count>
        <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by>
        <sys_updated_on>2020-06-03 05:52:37</sys_updated_on>
        <title>GlideAggregate default groupby</title>
    </x_0586_til_post>
</record_update>
